lines.content: It's your **todo bot** to help you managing your tasks!
All you need to do to use this bot is,
- [x] Manage your todo, deadlines, and events
> “Your mind is for having ideas, not holding them.” – David Allen
If you Java programmer, you can use it to practice Java too. Here's the main method:
* It contains the task content and deadline of each task
* Deadline contains a deadline which is written following "/by".
* It contains content information and deadline date (e.g. Monday)
* It overrides toString() method to change information of task to a string format.
* @return A string format of given task data
* Overriden toString() method to stringfy the data
* A simple todo bot to manage my todo list.
* It can mark done jobs or unmark.
* A simple todo bot that helps you to manage your tasks with deadline or occuring time.
* It begins the basic operation of the program when it is constructed.
* Takes filePath from main and creates Ui and storage from it.
* It can load previous data from the file path.
* Writes information of the task on the file
* @param currtask Current task that user has entered
* It uses a file writer to write the data on the file according to the user's input.
* @param currtask takes the current task to write (todo, deadline, or event)
public static void writeOn(Task currtask) throws IOException {
public static void run() throws IOException {
System.out.println("Here are the tasks in your list:");
System.out.println("Nice! I've marked this task as done:");
System.out.println("OK, I've marked this task as not done yet:");
System.out.println("Now you have " +tasklist.size()+ " tasks in the list");
System.out.println("Got it. I've added this task:");
System.out.println("Now you have " + tasklist.size() + " tasks in the list");
System.out.println("Got it. I've added this task:");
System.out.println("Now you have " + tasklist.size() + " tasks in the list");
Task current = new Event(froms[0], fromses[0], tos[1]);
System.out.println("Got it. I've added this task:");
System.out.println("OOPS!!! I'm sorry, but I don't know what that means :-(");
* Main method to manage my todo list
* Takes inputs from the user and send them to right classes.
* Main method of the todo bot. It generally manages inputs and outputs.
public static void main(String[] args) throws IOException {
* Contains the occuring time information of an event
* Event contains its occuring time (start time and end time)
* @param from starting time of the task
* @param to end time of the task
* @param from Start time of the event
* @param to End time of the event
Event(String content, String from, String to) {
* Overrides toString() method to change the task information to a string format.
* @return A string format of given task data
* It overrides toString() method to change information to a string format
* @return String format of the event task data
return "[E][" + this.getDone() + "] " + this.content + "(from:" + this.from + " to:" + this.to + ")";
* Deals with making sense of the user command
System.out.println("Here are the matching tasks in your list:");
* Stores data from the user and write it in the file,
* or load the data from given file.
* Deals with loading tasks from the file and saving tasks in the file
* It contains the file path to store or load data.
* @param filePath Takes filePath to save or load from
* Returns file path to load data.
* @return returns filePath to use in other classes.
* It contains information of the task content and if it is done.
* It includes information of if it is done and also change it as done.
* Contains the content of the task.
* Set the task to be done, which is true in this class.
* It marks the task as done (which is true in this class)
* Gives whether the task is done or not.
* @return "X" if it is done, or a blank if is not done.
* It shows whether the task is done or not.
* @return It returns "X" if it is done, and a blank if is not.
* Overriden toString() method which will be overriden again in subclasses.
* List of tasks which is made of a custom type Task
* TaskList constructor that loads data from the file of the path.
* It creates a new ArrayList to contain Task information in it.
* It first figures out what type of task it is (todo, deadline, or event),
* and divide the command and contents
this.list.add((Task) new Deadline(parts[0].substring(0, parts[0].length()-2), parts[1].substring(0, parts[1].length()-2)));
* It returns the size of the list
* Gives the task at the given index
* Gives the task of the given index
* Removes the task at the given index
* @param index index of the task that user wants to remove
* Add a new task that user has entered
* @param t New task that user wants to add on the list
* It is a default class of tasks that only contains content information.
* It is a default Task class that only contains the task context information
* It only contains the content of the task that user has entered.
* It overrides toString() method to change information to a string format.
* It overrides toString() method to change the information to a string format.
* @return A string format of the given task information
* Deals with interactions with the user
* It prints Loadding error message to user
System.out.println("Hello! I'm Duke\nWhat can I do for you?");
System.out.println("Bye. Hope to see you again soon!");
System.out.println("OOPS!!! The description of a todo cannot be empty.");
